ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 29
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, was I just heard about the Tinkerers Bag actually makes sense! Remember that alot of the tinkered items are substitutes for other spells like the Eye of
ygData.messageBody:
Well, was I just heard about the Tinkerers Bag actually
makes sense! Remember that alot of the tinkered items are
substitutes for other spells like the Eye of Zoom for
Wizards. Now, Shamans can summone 4 slot bags that whatever
you put in them is weightless. So, a 10 slot bag that does
the same thing and doesn't "poof" when you lose server
connection is a great idea and the code if the game already
does it successfully! Maybe I won't pay more than 70pp for
it currently but if I had more plat I would pay more! The
demand would be very great for those things because not
only casters with low strength need them, but everyone!



Have fun.
-Necro Gnome of Karana.




-----Original Message-----

Message: 1
Date: Tue, 13 Jul 1999 02:38:18 -0500
From: "Kevin Cook" <scatter@...>
Subject: Re: Fwd: Re: [EQ-Spoilers] Solusek's Eye

The bag of the tinkerers does exist, its 10 slots and 100 %
weight
reduction. It can be bought with max Charisma for about
6000 plat.

-----Original Message-----
From: Joshua Bednarz <thewhitemage@...>
To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>

>>>Subject: Re: [EQ-Spoilers] Solusek's Eye
>>>
>>>From: Entity <entity@...>
>>>
>>>I checked the bag again yesterday. The exact name of
the bag is "Bag of
>>>the Tinkerers" and the price was 6511pp. Heh. The
gnomes /con
>>>apprehensive to me tho and my charisma is the default
human wizard value
>>>+ 5.
>>>
>>>I also saw a named gnome which didn't answer my Hails
(again, must be
>>>because of the faction). He's on the 2nd floor on the
little fortress
>>>(on the above floor of where the merchant is, I believe).
>>>
>>>Speaking of which, ever since I started this thread, the
only new info I
>>>got was the goblin bartender one... Is there no one who
actually
>>>explored this dungeon throughly or is everyone waiting
to be spoonfed
>>>with a complete map with spawn locations and stuff? Or
is this dungeon
>>>so crappy that no one ever wasted time actually
exploring it...
>>>
>>>Oh and also, as far as I'm concerned, the only
*dangerous* lava is at
>>>the entrance. After that, there is still some lava here
and there but
>>>it isn't in dangerous/unescapable areas. There is one
instance where my
>>>group has to jump in the lava and it's to reach the gnome
>>>castle/city/stronghold and most of the time, that lava
doesn't hurt, tho
>>>I must admit it's funny seeing people jump around when
lava hurts them.
>>>:D I believe you can avoid the lava jump and end up in
the same place
>>>though but I'm just too lazy to find it as I think it
involves fighting.
>>>
>>>--
>>>Azurathe FireWrath
>>>Erollisi Marr
>>>
>>>Schafer, Timothy L 1425 wrote:
>>> >
>>> > From: "Schafer, Timothy L 1425"
<Timothy.Schafer@...>
>>> >
>>> > Actually this bag is around 2000pp.
>>> >
>>> > Wenaddar

Message: 3
Date: Tue, 13 Jul 1999 06:13:41 PDT
From: "Patrick Pichette" <poptart77@...>
Subject: Re: Fwd: Re: [EQ-Spoilers] Solusek's Eye

>BUT 8000pp! Geez. where do you get the money? Ive never
broken >100pp
>and I'm level
>26.

Well, maybe you've been focusing on a different aspect of
the game. My
level 10 friend had 100pp and now he's level 15 and has
made and/or spent
over 1000pp. I'm sure that by level 26 he will likely have
made and/or
spent over 5000pp.

Pietree

Message: 4
Date: Tue, 13 Jul 1999 09:10:54 -0500
From: "Fizzyl" <fizzyl@...>
Subject: Re: Thermal Cloak

I found a rawhide cloak in kithicor forest in a shop near
the west end of
the zone. I did not have the money to buy one, so I do not
know if they were
sold by a player, or always offered by the merchant. If
they were sold by a
player, then they probably come from the orcs near there.


> Message: 2
> Date: Mon, 12 Jul 1999 15:19:42 -0400
> From: MadGrizzle <MadGrizzle@...>

heard the newbie

(unfortunately I got rawhide

quest. Anyone
> know for sure?

From: Nosferatu <nosferatu@...>

in the bank.

climbing back up
the ladder. Trade skills are a wonderful thing.
/nos
